channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bridgend: Woman arrested in murder probe after boy, 2, dies
item.description: Police are not looking for anyone else in connection with the boy's death.

item.title: Wales' GCSE gap widens for children from poorer backgrounds
item.description: While those getting A*-C grades is up, it is lower for pupils from poorer backgrounds.

item.title: Reading: Teacher gets stories published after 46 years
item.description: Keith Godwin used to make up stories for his pupils in the 1970s, now they have been published.

item.title: Skate park 'devastated' after bid to reopen in Swansea refused
item.description: Ramps Skatepark, which wants to reopen in a new location, says it will appeal against the decision.

item.title: Fitness trackers used to monitor Wales sheep pregnancies
item.description: The devices measure how long the animals lie down, predicting when they will give birth.

item.title: Covid: Record visits to north Wales boost tourism
item.description: North Wales has overtaken Cornwall and Devon for staycations, one organisation says.

item.title: Crickhowell rape: Man arrested after Powys attack
item.description: Dyfed-Powys Police said the suspect, arrested on Tuesday, has been released under investigation.

item.title: Doctor who did locum shifts while on sick would 'lie and lie'
item.description: Dr Joao Muel is facing 13 allegations of dishonesty and clinical failure in 2018 and 2019, tribunal hears.

item.title: Cat of the year: Three-legged Minty wins charity award
item.description: Minty was recognised for his "special bond" with six-year-old Connor, who has learning difficulties.

item.title: Abercynon Road: Man charged after car crashed into vehicles
item.description: A man, charged with drink driving, will appear before magistrates after several cars were damaged.

item.title: Trellyffaint: Proof unearthed of Neolithic dairy farming in Pembrokeshire
item.description: Shards of decorated pottery containing traces of dairy fat residue have been dated to 3,100BC.

item.title: Covid: Record north Wales visitors after 'challenging' 18 months
item.description: North Wales has experienced a record-breaking summer for visitors, a tourism association says.

item.title: GCSEs: Wales' pupils celebrate as A and A* grades improve again
item.description: A and A* grades made up 28.7% of those awarded, compared with 18.4% when exams were last held in 2019.

item.title: Greece wildfires: 12-hour days for Welsh firefighter
item.description: The UK's 21-strong team includes four Welsh firefighters, who are unsure when they will return home.

item.title: Trolling of women in politics 'worrying'
item.description: Kirsty Williams said she had felt unable to keep her family safe from the trolling on social media.

item.title: Wales: Post-lockdown demand on ambulance staff 'relentless'
item.description: Paramedics and control room staff share their stories as pressure on services rises.

item.title: Lauren Price: Olympic boxer overwhelmed by 'insane' reception
item.description: The Welsh boxing champion was given a hero's welcome on her return to Ystrad Mynach.

item.title: Simon Carr: English-born, French-raised cyclist ties Welsh colours to mast for Vuelta a Espana
item.description: Simon Carr says you've probably never heard of him, but the young cyclist has declared himself available for Wales as he prepares to tackle the Vuelta a Espana.

item.title: Ciaron Brown: 'Why would I sell him to Warnock?' - Cardiff boss Mick McCarthy
item.description: Cardiff City manager Mick McCarthy says he will not be selling defender Ciaron Brown to Middlesbrough boss Neil Warnock based on the current offer on the table.

item.title: Jonathan Davies: Wales centre on return of full crowds and beating All Blacks
item.description: Wales centre Jonathan Davies on the return of capacity crowds, the 'struggle' of empty stadiums and the chance to beat New Zealand.

item.title: Cardiff City: Aden Flint says Mick McCarthy brought him back from 'wilderness'
item.description: Defender Aden Flint says he is grateful to be playing for Cardiff City again after being brought back from the "wilderness" by Mick McCarthy.

item.title: National League: Dover v Solihull Moors and Wrexham v Yeovil off amid Covid-19 outbreaks
item.description: Dover Athletic v Solihull Moors and Wrexham v Yeovil Town are both postponed due to Covid-19 outbreaks.

item.title: Ymchwiliad llofruddiaeth wedi i fachgen 2 oed farw
item.description: Mae menyw 31 wedi ei harestio ar amheuaeth o lofruddiaeth wedi digwyddiad ym Mhen-y-bont ar Ogwr.

item.title: TGAU: Mwy o fwlch rhwng y difreintiedig a'u cyfoedion
item.description: Mae nifer y disgyblion sy'n dod o gefndir difreintiedig ac wedi derbyn graddau rhwng A* a C wedi lleihau.

item.title: Gwyliau: Gogledd Cymru'n fwy poblogaidd na Chernyw
item.description: Busnesau twristiaeth yn dathlu haf prysur wrth i gyfyngiadau teithio dramor olygu mwy o bobl yn cymryd gwyliau yng Nghymru.

item.title: Unigrwydd cefn gwlad: 'Neb i siarad efo'
item.description: Gethin Bickerton a sut aeth ati i ddysgu i fyw gyda’i iechyd meddwl.

item.title: Gohirio gêm gyntaf Wrecsam oherwydd Covid-19
item.description: Mae'r gêm wedi'i gohirio ar ôl i achosion Covid-19 ddod i'r amlwg ymhlith carfan eu gwrthwynebwyr, Yeovil.
